verses.text: Be not thou envious against evil men, neither desire to be with them.
For their heart studieth destruction, and their lips talk of mischief.
Through wisdom is a house built; and by understanding it is established:
And by knowledge shall the chambers be filled with all precious and pleasant riches.
A wise man \add is\add* strong; and a man of knowledge increaseth strength.
For by wise counsel thou shalt make thy war: and in multitude of counselors \add there is\add* safety.
Wisdom \add is\add* too high for a fool: he openeth not his mouth in the gate.
He that deviseth to do evil shall be called a mischievous person.
The thought of foolishness \add is\add* sin: and the scorner \add is\add* an abomination to men.
\add If\add* thou faintest in the day of adversity, thy strength \add is\add* small.
If thou forbearest to deliver \add them that are\add* drawn to death, and \add those that are\add* ready to be slain;

If thou sayest, Behold, we knew it not; doth not he that pondereth the heart consider \add it\add* ? and he that keepeth thy soul, doth \add not\add* he know \add it\add* ? and will \add not\add* he render to \add every\add* man according to his works?
My son, eat thou honey, because \add it is\add* good; and the honey-comb, \add which is\add* sweet to thy taste:
So \add shall\add* the knowledge of wisdom \add be\add* to thy soul: when thou hast found \add it\add* , then there shall be a reward, and thy expectation shall not be cut off.
Lay not wait, O wicked \add man\add* , against the dwelling of the righteous; destroy not his resting-place:
For a just \add man\add* falleth seven times, and riseth again: but the wicked shall fall into mischief.
Rejoice not when thy enemy falleth, and let not thy heart be glad when he stumbleth:
Lest the LORD see \add it\add* , and it displease him, and he turn away his wrath from him.
Fret not thyself because of evil \add men\add* , neither be thou envious at the wicked;
For there shall be no reward to the evil \add man\add* ; the candle of the wicked shall be extinguished.
My son, fear thou the LORD and the king: \add and\add* meddle not with them that are given to change:
For their calamity shall rise suddenly; and who knoweth the ruin of them both?
These \add things\add* also \add belong\add* to the wise. \add It is\add* not good to have respect of persons in judgment.
He that saith to the wicked, Thou \add art\add* righteous; him shall the people curse, nations shall abhor him:
But to them that rebuke \add him\add* shall be delight, and a good blessing shall come upon them.
\add Every man\add* shall kiss \add his\add* lips that giveth a right answer.
Prepare thy work without, and make it fit for thyself in the field; and afterwards build thy house.
Be not a witness against thy neighbor without cause; and deceive \add not\add* with thy lips.
Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me: I will render to the man according to his work.
I went by the field of the slothful, and by the vineyard of the man void of understanding;
And lo, it was all grown over with thorns, \add and\add* nettles had covered the face of it, and its stone wall was broken down.
Then I saw, \add and\add* considered \add it\add* well: I looked upon \add it\add* , \add and\add* received instruction.
\add Yet\add* a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:
So shall thy poverty come \add as\add* one that traveleth; and thy want as an armed man.
